meanings.definition: Deceptive or misleading in appearance or reasoning.
meanings.sent1: The magician's sophistical tricks amazed the audience.
meanings.sent2: She used sophistical arguments to win the debate.
meanings.sent3: The sophistical salesman tried to sell me a broken watch as brand new.
meanings.sent4: His sophistical smile hid his true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The movie's plot twist was so sophistical that no one saw it coming.

meanings.sent5: The maze's layout was so sophistical that even experienced adventurers got lost.
